result.execSummary:
The defendant Maxwell Ac Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/Pass.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def successfully completed TAD.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP. Agreement reached w/def to complete TAD.  State recommends 10 days Co Jail w/huber if TAD completed and no new bailjump charges, 110 days jail w/huber if not completed; fine of $1368; $60 blood draw cost; 18 mos DL rev (no IID); AODA.  Def enters guilty plea. Court finds def guilty.  Court admonishes def re terms of bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Atty Alyssa Armbrust appearing for Def.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def is in TAD program w/completion expected in February.  TAD offer was made to def prior to counsel being appointed.  Counsel req adj.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP  Counsel's first appearance; def has been admitted into TAD w/completion expected in Feb, 2016.  Counsel req adj.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. No contact with MMS
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def appeared in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Pretrial held; TAD offer rec'd - def to check on eligibility.  Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Court sets $1000 signature bond.    Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
